comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: San Francisco Call, Volume 115, Number 156, 29 December 1913 cdnc.ucr.edu/cgi-bin/cdnc?a=d&d=SFC19131229.2.142 reports that Miss Lucy Hoke Smith was to marry Ensign Alston R. Simpson he next day.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
11418107@N02
comment._content: She had two children, Hoke Smith Simpson, and Maude Raymur Simpson. Presumably the baby is one of these two people.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Evening Independent (St. Petersburg, Florida), Jun 15, 1927 news.google.com/newspapers?nid=950&dat=19270615&i... makes clear that Lucy and her husband had a difficult marriage. This article notes that she is petitioning for divorce for the second time. After the first divorce, they were re-married. This 1927 piece mentions the two children -- Hoke Smith Simpson, 12 and Maude Raymor Simpson, 9. These ages don't match the dates of birth pennylrichardsca found, but one of those she found is before the engagement -- which seems unlikely. If the ages in the article are correct, a 1916 photo (1916 is on the date sticker on the negative) is most likely Hoke Smith Simpson.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/23103743@N05] Agreed--the dates I found are clearly wrong. I'll remove them. (One of my other projects right now involves a woman who constantly made up her age, no consistency in it at all, it gets frustrating to work out what's what!)

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: This photo was reproduced in The Pickens sentinel., October 21, 1915, Image 2 entitled "MRS. A. R. SIMPSON AND SON" (must then be Hoke Smith Simpson). The birth of the daughter was in March 1918; The Washington times., March 26, 1918, FINAL EDITION, Image 14, Col. 2 & 3 reported that Lieut. Alston R. Simpson and his wife were receiving congratulations on this event.

comment.author: 35075914@N06
comment._content: We'll add the names to the record. Thanks!
